about.title: Meet Insureversia
about.subtitle: Your guide to navigating AI in insurance.
about.hubCard1Desc: Our identity, mission, core thesis, principles, and important notices.
about.hubCard2Desc: What you'll find here, a guided tour of every section, and a complete site map.
about.hubCard3Desc: The people and organization behind Insureversia, born from CEMI.ai.
about.whatIsDesc: Insureversia is your independent guide to artificial intelligence in the insurance industry. We exist to help insurance professionals — underwriters, claims adjusters, brokers, actuaries, compliance officers, and executives — understand, evaluate, and responsibly adopt AI tools.
about.missionDesc: To provide insurance professionals with practical, ethical, and evidence-based guidance for navigating the AI transformation — so they can serve their clients better, work more efficiently, and lead with confidence.
about.coreThesisQuote: The insurance professionals most at risk are not those who will be replaced by AI — they are those who refuse to understand it.
about.principleEvidenceDesc: Every claim is backed by sources. We cite regulations, industry reports, and real-world case studies.
about.principlePractitionerDesc: Built for working insurance professionals, not theorists. Practical tools you can use today.
about.principleEthicalDesc: We address bias, fairness, transparency, and accountability head-on. AI power demands responsibility.
about.principleAccessibleDesc: Clear language, structured learning paths, and content for every experience level.
about.principleMultilingualDesc: Available in English and Spanish, because AI in insurance is a global conversation.
about.principleCurrentDesc: The AI landscape evolves rapidly. We update our content to reflect new developments, regulations, and tools.
about.importantNoticeDesc: Insureversia provides educational content about AI in insurance. Nothing on this site constitutes insurance advice, legal advice, or professional recommendations. Always consult qualified professionals for specific insurance decisions.
about.whatYouWillFindDesc: Insureversia is organized into five main sections, each designed to take you deeper into AI for insurance — from understanding the landscape to hands-on practice.
about.siteMapDesc: Every page on Insureversia, organized by section.
about.bornFromCemiDesc: Insureversia is a project of CEMI.ai — the Center for Meaningful Innovation in Artificial Intelligence. CEMI.ai develops educational platforms, tools, and methodologies that help professionals and organizations navigate AI responsibly.
about.curatorBio: Stanford Fellow with 25+ years of experience at the intersection of technology, education, and social impact. Chief Innovation Officer at CEMI.AI. Recognized by CNN, MIT, Forbes, and Google for his work in digital innovation.

aiReadiness.techQ1: Our organization has reliable, modern technology infrastructure (fast internet, current hardware, cloud access)
aiReadiness.techQ2: We have experience with software tools beyond basic office suites (policy management, claims systems, CRM platforms)
aiReadiness.techQ3: Our team is comfortable trying new digital tools and adapting to technology changes
aiReadiness.culturalQ1: Leadership actively supports exploring new technologies and innovations
aiReadiness.culturalQ2: There is openness among team members to changing established workflows

learningProgram.problemP2: You don't need another webinar. You need a structured, hands-on program designed for the way you work — one that starts with understanding who you are as a professional and a learner.
learningProgram.pillar1Desc: Every program starts with a scientific assessment of your role, goals, and learning style. No two programs are the same.
learningProgram.pillar2Desc: Case studies, role simulations, real-world scenarios. Text, audio, and video formats. You learn by doing, not by watching.

personas.sectionSubtitle: Three fictional voices representing the real spectrum of perspectives on AI in insurance. Each brings a distinct philosophy, professional background, and cultural lens to the conversation.

vera.name: Vera Nakamura-Obi
vera.role: Chief Strategy Officer, Pacific Rim Reinsurance Group
vera.quote: The question is never whether to adopt AI. The question is whether you have the discipline to adopt it well.
vera.bio: Japanese-Nigerian, raised in Lagos, MBA from INSEAD. Vera has spent three decades navigating global reinsurance markets. She sees AI as a strategic tool — powerful when deployed with discipline, dangerous when adopted without it. Her philosophy: technology amplifies whatever culture already exists.
vera.photoAlt: Vera Nakamura-Obi — The Strategist, Chief Strategy Officer

bruno.name: Bruno Vasquez-Herrera
bruno.role: Senior Claims Director, Regional Insurance Cooperative
bruno.quote: Every claim has a face. Every denial has a consequence. Before you automate that decision, ask yourself: would you explain it to the person on the other side?
bruno.bio: Chilean-Costa Rican, born in San José. Bruno has spent two decades in claims, where he has seen technology promise efficiency and sometimes deliver injustice. He believes AI must earn trust through transparency, accountability, and a relentless focus on the humans behind every policy.
bruno.photoAlt: Bruno Vasquez-Herrera — The Guardian, Senior Claims Director

zaira.name: Zaira Mensah-Okonkwo
zaira.quote: Somewhere right now, a farmer cannot insure a harvest, a family cannot afford a policy, a claim is stuck in a pile. AI can change that. The question is: why haven't we already?
zaira.bio: Ghanaian-South African, grew up between Accra and Cape Town. Zaira represents the next generation of insurance professionals — impatient with the status quo, driven by the gap between what technology can do and what the industry actually does. She pushes for speed, scale, and inclusion.
zaira.photoAlt: Zaira Mensah-Okonkwo — The Catalyst, InsurTech Innovation Lead
